text:
Light up an


LED for the first 


time
description: Get familiar with basic LED circuits by lighting up an LED.
tasks: Connect an LED to a power source
Observe polarity when connecting the LED
Test different resistor values to control brightness

text:
Learn to


use wire strippers
description: Understand how to strip insulation from wires without damaging them.
tasks: Select the correct gauge for the wire
Practice stripping wire without cutting strands
Learn proper hand positioning for safe operation

text:
Complete


an electronics kit
description: Assemble a basic electronics kit to learn components and circuit building.
tasks: Identify all components included in the kit
Test the assembled circuit for functionality

text: Learn to Solder
description: Gain soldering skills essential for electronics assembly.
tasks: Set up a soldering station with safety precautions
Understand proper soldering techniques and heat control

text:
Learn to use


a breadboard
description: Learn how to build circuits on a breadboard without soldering.
tasks: Understand the rows and columns of a breadboard
Build a simple circuit using a breadboard

text:
Get a circuit


wrong and try


again
description: Learn from mistakes by troubleshooting and fixing circuit issues.
tasks: Analyze the circuit for possible issues
Test the corrected circuit to confirm functionality

text:
Learn Ohm’s


Law
description: Understand the relationship between voltage, current, and resistance.
tasks: Use Ohm's law to calculate circuit values
Apply formulas in practical circuit examples
Experiment with resistor values to observe changes

text:
Fix something


that’s broken
tasks: Identify the issue with the broken item
Gather necessary tools and replacement parts
Repair and test to ensure functionality

text:
Measure 


voltage with 


a multimeter
description: Learn to measure voltage in circuits using a multimeter.
tasks: Set the multimeter to measure voltage
Connect probes to the correct circuit points

text:
Learn to


read a schematic
description: Understand how to interpret electronic schematics.
tasks: Trace the flow of a simple circuit on paper

text:
Learn to read


a datasheet
description: Understand how to interpret datasheets to get essential specifications for components.

text:
Learn to


control the 


brightness of


 an LED
description: Learn to control LED brightness using resistors and PWM signals.

text:
Learn to 


desolder a   


through hole


component
description: Acquire the skill of removing components from a circuit board using desoldering techniques.

text:
Make  


something that 


makes noise
description: Create a simple noise-making circuit using a speaker or buzzer.

text:
Turn a  


breadboard 


circuit into a  


schematic
description: Translate a physical breadboard setup into a formal schematic diagram.

text:
Measure 


current with a  


multimeter
description: Learn to use a multimeter to accurately measure current in a circuit.
tasks: Verify the current with different multimeter settings

text:
Make a voltage 


divider to lower  


the voltage  


for a project
description: Use resistors to create a voltage divider for adjusting voltage levels.

text:
Turn 


something  


on using  


a sensor
description: Use a sensor to trigger an action, such as turning on an LED or motor.
tasks: Explore using a sensor to control a fan

text:
Use a diode 


protect your  


circuit from  


reverse voltages
description: Prevent damage to circuits from reverse polarity by adding a protection diode.
tasks: Place diode in series with load
Understand how diodes prevent circuit damage

text:
Make an 


oscillator that


makes noise
description: Design a simple oscillator circuit to produce sound with a speaker.

text:
Use a relay 


to switch


something on at


a higher voltage
description: Learn to control high voltage circuits with a relay.
tasks: Connect relay to a low voltage trigger
Test the relay with a high voltage load
Use a relay to control motors

text:
Make a 


 capacitor rocket


 (too much voltage)
description: Understand the effects of over-voltage on capacitors and safety.
tasks: Observe and document the effects of over-voltage

text:
Learn to 


 solder surfcace


 mount parts
description: Practice surface mount soldering techniques for compact circuits.
tasks: Use solder paste with a stencil
Heat with a hot air gun
Practice soldering with different component sizes

text:
Use a 


  555 timer


 in a circuit
description: Understand how to use a 555 timer for timing and oscillation.
tasks: Set up a basic timing circuit

text:
Make a sound 


 louder with an


amplifier
description: Learn how to amplify audio signals with a basic amplifier circuit.

text:
Use  


addressable 


 RGB LEDs in a 


project
description: Learn to control individual LEDs in an addressable RGB LED strip.

text:
Make a  


project 


 with a  


Raspberry Pi
description: Explore possibilities of Raspberry Pi in electronics projects.

text:
Let the 


smoke out 


 accidentally
description: Experience accidental component burnout and learn from it.
tasks: Identify why the component burnt out
Document and learn for future projects

text:
Use fritzing 


or TinkerCAD 


 to create a  


 circuit diagram
description: Learn to use software tools to visualize circuit designs.
tasks: Familiarize with Fritzing or TinkerCAD interface

text:
Make 


something 


 with Arduino
description: Use Arduino to control and automate electronic components.
tasks: Set up an Arduino with IDE
Use sensors to interact with the project

text:
Let the smoke 


out of an Arduino 


 accidentally
description: Understanding the effects of incorrect wiring or power on Arduino boards.
tasks: Set up a simple circuit with an Arduino
Observe the board's response to incorrect power input
Learn proper handling and protection for electronics

text:
Measure 


frequency with a 


 multimeter
description: Learning to measure the frequency of signals using a digital multimeter.
tasks: Measure frequency of a signal generator
Calibrate the multimeter for accurate measurements

text:
Use an 


Op-Amp  in


  a circuit
description: Applying an operational amplifier in basic circuits for signal processing.
tasks: Set up a basic Op-Amp circuit

text:
Use a crowbar


circuit to protect


 against over voltage
description: Exploring crowbar circuits for overvoltage protection.
tasks: Set up a simple crowbar circuit
Test its response to high-voltage conditions

text:
Use a surge


diode to protect


 a circuit
description: Understanding the role of surge diodes in protecting circuits from spikes.
tasks: Learn about surge diodes and their placement
Integrate a surge diode into a basic circuit
Test the circuit under simulated surge conditions
Understand the effect of surges on components

text:
Make


something


 for a friend
description: Creating an electronics project as a personalized gift.

text:
Make a motor


controller with


 a H Bridge
description: Building a motor controller using an H-Bridge circuit for bidirectional control.
tasks: Assemble an H-Bridge for motor control
Test motor control in forward and reverse directions
Ensure proper cooling for the H-Bridge circuit

text:
Make a


counter with


 logic gates
description: Building a digital counter using logic gates for counting applications.
tasks: Test the counting sequence and reset function
Explore the use of flip-flops in counters

text:
Apply solder


paste to a PCB


 with a stencil
description: Learning to apply solder paste to a PCB using a stencil for accurate placement.
tasks: Position the stencil on a PCB
Apply solder paste through the stencil

text:
Teach a


friend an


 electronics skill
description: Sharing electronics knowledge by teaching a friend a new skill.
tasks: Choose a simple electronics skill to teach
Assist your friend with hands-on learning
Create a project to demonstrate the skill

text:
Make something


with a 7


 segment display
description: Learn how to control a 7-segment display and create simple numeric displays.
tasks: Connect the 7-segment display to a microcontroller
Explore multiplexing techniques for multiple displays

text:
Measure


voltage with an


 oscilloscope
description: Use an oscilloscope to measure voltage waveforms and understand signal characteristics.
tasks: Set up the oscilloscope for voltage measurement
Use the oscilloscope to troubleshoot circuit problems

text:
Measure


capacitor equivalent


 series resistance
description: Learn how to measure the Equivalent Series Resistance (ESR) of capacitors using appropriate tools.
tasks: Understand the impact of ESR on circuit performance

text:
Make an


Internet of Things


  (IoT) project
description: Create an IoT project to control or monitor a device remotely using internet connectivity.
tasks: Set up a microcontroller with Wi-Fi
Develop code to send and receive data

text:
Make 


something with


 solar panels
description: Learn to incorporate solar panels in electronics projects to create energy-efficient devices.
tasks: Connect panels to a battery or device

text:
Look at an 


 audio input


on an oscilloscope
description: Visualize audio waveforms on an oscilloscope to study audio signals and frequencies.
tasks: Connect audio input to the oscilloscope
Adjust settings for audio signal clarity
Analyze different types of audio signals

text:
Make a 


 regulated


power supply
description: Build a power supply that outputs a stable voltage for your electronic projects.
tasks: Ensure the power supply is protected from overcurrent

text:
Use a MOSFET 


 instead of a relay


in a project
description: Learn to use MOSFETs as switches for efficient control in circuits.
tasks: Test switching behavior with different loads

text:
Make your 


 own


USB cable
description: Learn the wiring and assembly required to create a custom USB cable.
tasks: Test the custom cable for data and power

text:
Use an LED 


 matrix in


a project
description: Learn to control an LED matrix to display patterns and characters.
tasks: Connect the LED matrix to a microcontroller
Write code to control individual LEDs

text:
Filter 


  unwanted noise


from a signal
description: Learn how to filter out noise in electronic signals to improve signal quality.
tasks: Identify the source of unwanted noise
Test and adjust the filter for optimal performance

text:
Use a freqency 


  analyser


for a project
description: Understand how to use a frequency analyzer to visualize and analyze signal frequencies.
tasks: Set up the frequency analyzer with your circuit
Adjust settings to capture the signal

text:
Order a 


PCB with


your design
description: Learn the process of ordering a custom PCB based on your own design.
tasks: Create a PCB design using software
Check for design errors or optimizations
Order the PCB from a manufacturer
Track the production and delivery process

text:
Repair a 


broken trace


on a PCB
description: Learn to repair broken or damaged PCB traces effectively.
tasks: Clean the area around the damaged trace
Use a solder bridge or jumper wire to repair

text:
Use  


automatic


gain control
description: Implement automatic gain control to keep audio or signal levels consistent.
tasks: Understand the basics of automatic gain control
Design or find an AGC circuit
Integrate AGC into your project and test it

text:
Make a  


PID circuit


with Op-Amps
description: Build a Proportional-Integral-Derivative (PID) circuit using operational amplifiers.
tasks: Select the right Op-Amps and resistors
Test the circuit and make adjustments
Analyze the PID response under different conditions

text:
Teach a   


 class on


Electronics
description: Prepare and conduct a basic electronics class for beginners.
tasks: Create a lesson plan covering key electronics concepts
Engage students and answer questions effectively

text:
Learn  


 PCB Design


Software
description: Get familiar with software used for designing printed circuit boards.
tasks: Choose and install a PCB design software
Follow a tutorial to design a simple PCB

text:
Use an  


 e-paper display


in a project
description: Learn how to integrate and control an e-paper display in an electronics project.
tasks: Set up the e-paper display module
Write code to display images or text
Learn about different e-paper display technologies

text:
Build a  


 Radio Frequency


(RF)Project
description: Develop a project that involves radio frequency (RF) components and signals.
tasks: Choose an RF module suitable for your project
Design the circuit to work with RF signals
Test and troubleshoot RF transmission issues

text:
Make an  


 open source


project
description: Develop a project that is accessible to the public and encourages collaboration and modification.
tasks: Engage with the community for feedback and contributions
resources: How to contribute to open source: https://www.firsttimersonly.com/

text:
Use capacitive  


 touch in a PCB


design
description: Implement capacitive touch sensors on a printed circuit board to detect touch inputs.
tasks: Test and calibrate the touch response
Learn about different capacitive touch sensing techniques

text:
Make  


 something 


with PCB Art
description: Create a visually appealing design on a PCB, focusing on aesthetics and functionality.
tasks: Add design elements like silkscreen patterns
Incorporate color to enhance the design

text:
Make an  


 electronic 


sculpture
description: Construct an electronic sculpture that combines art with circuit design for a functional, aesthetic piece.

text:
Make a switch  


 mode power 


supply
description: Design a switch-mode power supply to efficiently convert electrical power for various applications.
tasks: Test and refine the power output
resources: Switch-mode power supply principles: https://www.electronic tutorials.com/smps/

text:
Release a   


 tutorial on a 


project you've made
description: Create a tutorial that explains a project, guiding others on how to replicate it.
tasks: Record and edit a video or write a guide
Publish the tutorial on a platform
Promote your tutorial for wider reach

text:
Create an   


 FPGA Project
description: Design a project utilizing an FPGA, leveraging hardware programming for specialized tasks.
tasks: Test and debug the FPGA design
Optimize the FPGA design for performance

text:
Write your  


 own C/C++ library 


 for a sensor 


 from scratch
description: Develop a custom C/C++ library for interfacing with a sensor, including functionality and data handling.
tasks: Test the library with the sensor
Learn about data handling in C++
